After over 10 years of using JUnit, it has only just struck me that test me=
thods must return void, but why?

I've just come across an example where a =
particular test did a lot of work, and I wanted to piggy-back on its final =
state by calling the method from another test. Is there any fundamental rea=
son for not allowing me to return values? It might even be an opportunity t=
o write an annotation expressing constraints about the value returned.

Che=
ers

Duncan McGregor
